result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett A. Grulke

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 9  am. 
Defendant Brett A. Grulke in court with Attorney Nicholas Rifelj. ADA Theresa Beck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.
Service of the Amended Information is admitted; reading is waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 

Constitutional rights are reviewed; elements are recited; pleas of " No Contest " are entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated.  
As to Count #2: the Court accepts the plea, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
As to Count #1:  the Court accepts the plea and withholds entry of judgment.

As to Count #1: the Court endorses the Deferred Prosecution Agreement of the parties.  This DPA is for a period of an 18 month period. Completion of the DPA would result in dismissal of Count #1.  

As to Count #2: the Court sentences Mr. Grulke to:
--serve 5  days in Jefferson County Jail, this is a time-served jail term
--6 days credit for time already served given 
--within 15 days Mr. Grulke needs to write a letter of apology to Officer Zubke; a copy of this letter is to be filed with the Court 
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge= $443. The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in the interpreter of a civil judgment. 
The Court orders the Defendant to comply with DNA sample provision.
recess 10:08am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[MK] case called at 8:38am
Defendant Brett A. Grulke in court with Attorney Nicholas Rifelj. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.  
Mr. Grulke waives his right to preliminary hearing. The Court accepts this waiver and binds the Defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment:  
Service of Information is admitted; reading is waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Defense stands mute. The Court enters a plea of "not guilty" on the Defendant's behalf.
In response to the Court's inquiry, Attorney Grulke indicates the Defense is not requesting speedy trial. 
recess 8:45am 

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on  September 16th at 10:00am

Adjustment Number: 22A 162888,
Payable Number: 193625,
Receipt Number: 22R 013208,
Amount: $20.00

Pre-trial conference on August 10, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Conditions of Bond include: 
--not to make any acts or threats of violence
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription

[MK] case called at 1:40pm 
Defendant Brett A. Grulke appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Nelson agrees that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Attorney Nelson verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--not to make any acts or threats of violence
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
recess 1:45pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on August 10th at 9:40am--only counsel need to appear,  (2) Preliminary Hearing on August 19th at 8:30am
